definition: to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions
to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: Instead of punishing a child for violating a school policy, they battle the policy.
sentences.chinese: 不因爲觸犯了學校的紀律懲罰孩子，而是攻擊校規。

sentences.english: Any one who breaks the law should be punished.
sentences.chinese: 任何觸犯法律的人都應受到懲罰。

sentences.english: They are an appropriate venue for trying detainees for violations of the laws of war.
sentences.chinese: 軍事委員會是審理觸犯戰爭法的在押人員的合適場所。

sentences.english: the offensive offender defended himself with the fence.
sentences.chinese: 那個厭惡的觸犯者用竹籬自衛。

sentences.english: He was arrested on a charge of having infringed the Election Law.
sentences.chinese: 他因被指控觸犯選舉法而被拘捕。

sentences.english: The Delegate-General for National Security emphasized that it was a violation of Cameroonian law.
sentences.chinese: 國家安全總代表強調說這是對喀麥隆法律的觸犯。

sentences.english: Yemeni interest in the star-crossed lovers touches on geopolitics, too.
sentences.chinese: 也門人對跨越界限又觸犯地緣政治的戀人也很感興趣。

sentences.english: The old chancellor who had offended against the emperor was relegated to the distant boundaries of the country.
sentences.chinese: 觸犯了皇帝的老宰相被流放到遙遠的邊疆。

sentences.english: Vick fell foul of a Federal ban on dogfighting.
sentences.chinese: 維克觸犯了關於不允許鬥狗的一條聯邦禁令。

sentences.english: Offenders are liable to fines of up to 100.
sentences.chinese: 觸犯者可予罰款達100英鎊。

sentences.english: A publicized incident that brings about disgrace or offends the moral sensibilities of society
sentences.chinese: 醜聞帶來不光彩或觸犯社會道德標準的公開事件。

sentences.english: Lit. Unless you offend the Government, you can do anything in China.
sentences.chinese: 中國你想可以做嘢，除非觸犯政府。

sentences.english: He violated criminal law in two car smuggling cases, constituting smuggling.
sentences.chinese: 他在兩起汽車走私案中觸犯刑律，構成走私罪。

sentences.english: You could easily break one of our laws and not know it.
sentences.chinese: 你非常容易在不知情的情況下觸犯法律。

sentences.english: To enter was to breach the protocols of a club privée.
sentences.chinese: 進入博物館彷彿觸犯了俱樂部的清規。

sentences.english: They did not abide by the customs laws in any way.
sentences.chinese: 從各方面來看，他們都是在觸犯海關法律。
